* Salesforce certifications (e.g., Platform Developer I/II) are a plus but not mandatory.
* Passion for technology, teamwork, and delivering exceptional results.



  





**What We Offer** 



* Competitive salary and benefits package.
* Opportunity to work with a leading IT consulting firm known for its innovative projects.
* Supportive and collaborative team environment.
* Professional development opportunities, including certifications and training.
* A chance to work on exciting and technically complex Salesforce implementations.
* Hybrid working options



  





**How to Apply** 




 Ready to elevate your Salesforce career? Send your updated CV to
 **s.maritz@masonfrank.com** 
 by
 **5th December 2024** 
 to arrange a confidential call and explore this opportunity further.
 



  





 Let’s transform the future of IT together!
 



  





 #sweden #salesforce #salesforcedevelopment #softwaredevelopment #salescloud #servicecloud #stockholm

title: Engineering Manager - Site Reliability Engineering
description:
****Join our global force of 500+ innovators, blending the latest in tech with the greatest in soundtracking, from our Stockholm HQ to offices in London, New York, Los Angeles, Berlin, Oslo, and Seoul. We’re an industry leader with a startup mentality. We take what we do seriously, but we don’t take ourselves too seriously. Creating and collaborating to transform the sound of streaming, content, and culture. Come join us—and let the world feel your work.****
 We are looking for an experienced Engineering Manager to lead one of our core platform teams, Site Reliability Engineering (SRE). In this role you’ll oversee the team’s people, processes, delivery, technical product, and cross-team collaborations. Collaborating closely with the team, neighbouring teams, and Staff Engineers, you’ll drive critical infrastructure that impacts the entire company.
   

  

 You’ll guide a collaborative, inclusive, and high-performing team that thrives on shared decision-making, knowledge-sharing, and fostering a psychologically safe environment. Your role will include refining team processes, building and prioritizing backlogs, clarifying requirements, and engaging with stakeholders across the company. Your experience in crafting technical platforms in other organizations will bring valuable insights, while your open-mindedness will help shape our approach.
   

  

**How You Will Make An Impact**
* Lead and grow a high-performing team by providing mentorship, coaching, and technical guidance while fostering a culture of collaboration, trust, and continuous improvement.
* Drive infrastructure excellence by ensuring the platform is scalable, reliable, and optimized for fast, efficient product delivery.
* Partner with other teams and stakeholders to align the platform’s development with organizational priorities and technical goals.
* Enhance team processes by refining workflows, prioritizing backlogs, and clarifying technical and product requirements to maximize efficiency and impact.
* Shape the vision for the platform’s future, inspiring the team to innovate and successfully bring that vision to life.


**What We’re Looking For**
* Solid technical background with expertise in modern SRE practices and cloud technology.
* Proven experience managing and growing SRE teams.
* Extensive understanding of technical platforms, team dynamics, software delivery and system design.
* Ability to foster a psychologically safe work environment for your team.


**It would also be music to our ears if you have**
* Experience with technical product development, focusing on Developer Experience.
* Hands-on familiarity with tools and technologies like Go/TypeScript, GKE, Terraform, Observability stacks, and CI/CD pipelines (ArgoCD, GitHub Actions).


**Equal Opportunity Employer**
 We believe that bringing people together from different backgrounds, experiences and perspectives makes for a healthy workplace, a more successful business and a better world. We value diversity and encourage everyone to come and soundtrack the world with us.
   

  

**Application**
 Do you want to be a part of our fantastic team? Please apply, in English, by clicking the link below.
   

  

 We embrace a hybrid work setup that offers the freedom and flexibility to balance your personal and professional life. At the same time, we value the collaboration, creativity, and connection that comes from spending the majority of our time together in the office. This approach allows us to innovate as a team while giving you the autonomy to work in a way that suits you best.
   

  

**Join our global force of 500+ innovators, blending the latest in tech with the greatest in soundtracking, from our Stockholm HQ to offices in London, New York, Los Angeles, Berlin, Oslo, and Seoul. We’re an industry leader with a startup mentality. We take what we do seriously, but we don’t take ourselves too seriously. Creating and collaborating to transform the sound of streaming, content, and culture. Come join us—and let the world feel your work.**

title: Partner Development Management - Managed Services Partners
description:
The Global Partner Solutions (GPS) team is a sales organization accountable for the commercial partner business at Microsoft, and the mission is to build and sell Microsoft Cloud applications, services and devices with partners, empowering people, and organizations to achieve more.
   

  

 As a Partner Development Manager for Managed Services Partners (MSP), you will be responsible for leading your partners' commercial performance as well as driving their transformation into a Microsoft Cloud MSP with a strong focus on Azure and Microsoft 365.
   

  

 Your role will involve developing and driving business strategy between Microsoft and your partner, acting as a trusted advisor and business leader. You will build strong Partner Business Plan with goals aligned between the partners’ and Microsoft, building strong C-Suite relationships and ensuring collaborating across multiple stakeholders (partner and Microsoft) to accelerate performance.
   

  

 You will bring your tenacious work ethic, your enthusiasm, optimism, and your passion to foster profound growth and change within our channel partner ecosystem.
   

  

 You will leverage your challenger mindset, deep technology industry knowledge, market insights, expert understanding of the competitive landscape, executive presence and best in class interpersonal abilities to empower your regional and area teams to grow our robust ecosystem of world class channel partners.
   

  

 To be successful in this role you need strong insights and experience, first hand, from the Managed Services Business.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
**Partner development and growth**
* You will develop and execute a strategic and tactical partner business plan aligned with Microsoft goals and objectives for managed partners to grow their business.
* You will promote cloud consumption and digital transformation; plans will consider short and long-term goals and performance expectations aligned with partner needs and capabilities.
* You will support and drive the transformation of partners’ from MSP to Cloud MSP with a focus on scalable managed service offerings on Azure. This involves guiding partners through the process of integrating Azure services into their existing infrastructure and helping them develop a robust hybrid cloud strategy.


**Partner Sales and Acceleration**
* You will develop a go to market plan and co-sell execution tactics, lead partner pipeline reviews and coach partners to transform their strategies around sales and consumption.
* You will facilitate collaboration between partner and Microsoft sales teams to overcome obstacles, compete, and create proposals to meet consumption and revenue targets.
* You will work with your partner on top opportunities following the Microsoft sales methodology and prioritize transactions through marketplace, where possible.


**Partner performance and Impact**
* You will be responsible for your partners’ performance with Microsoft and accountable for keeping a regular rhythm of connection with executive, sales and delivery teams to identify and resolve blockers in execution, and to accelerate performance.
* You will drive adoption, usage and performance of programs and investments that contribute to sales and consumption.


**Executive Relationship Building**
* You will build a trusted-advisor relationship with C-suite leaders of complex partners and align their priorities, strategies, and goals with Microsoft’s to build mutually beneficial account plans and achieve strategic alignment and growth.


**Partner Skills And Capacity Building**
* You will lead the integration of capability and capacity plans for your partners utilizing the right mix of sales and tech training to upskill the partner.
* You will enable partners to build high-impact Microsoft offerings and practices to grow their business and deliver cloud consumption and digital transformation.


**Qualifications**
**Required qualifications:**
* Bachelor's Degree in Marketing, Business Operations, Computer Science or a related field AND proven experience in partner management, sales, business development, or partner channel development in the technology industry or related experience OR equivalent experience
* This role requires proficiency in written, reading, and conversational Swedish as you will be assigned to the Swedish Customer Market


 Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. Consistent with applicable law, all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, citizenship, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, immigration status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran or military status, race, ethnicity, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable local laws, regulations and ordinances. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application process, read more about requesting accommodations.

title: IT System Manager: Lead Our Tech Infrastructure!
description:
Om tjänsten
   

  

 You will become part of Customer IT. Customer IT develops and operates specialized IT solutions closely together with business colleagues to create value for our customers. Customer IT is set up locally, in Sweden, Germany, Netherlands, and Poland. By joining us, you will directly support Vattenfall’s mission to enable customers to make fossil-free choices.
   

  

 As a
 **System Manager** 
 you would be part of a DevOps scrum team designing, creating, and maintaining solutions based on the MS Azure technology stack. In doing so, we as IT partner up with our colleagues from the various departments within Vattenfall daily. The tasks and projects are varied and so are the data, the use cases, and the technology.
   

  

 Within the team you are in continuous dialogue with the experts and your fellow Data Engineers in order to maintain and optimize state-of-the-art analytics solutions.
   

  

**Your Tasks And Responsibilities**
* As a System Manager you are having end to end responsibility for the solution which includes:
* Cost and budget follow up for the SLA (Service Level Agreement)
* Having regular maintenance meetings with the business
* Making a roadmap for what is needed to maintain the system (including Lifecycle management, upgrades etc.)
* Supporting Business Users on incidents
* Following ITIL process within the SLA
* Guarantee system security - ISMS1042, vulnerability management etc.


 Din bakgrund
   

  

**We are looking for a candidate with:**
* A technical background with an understanding of how software solutions are brought into life in an agile setup.
* Prior experience of working in high pace environment taking care of multiple product delivery processes and involved in putting structure to them.
* DevOps Practices: Familiarity with CI/CD pipelines, containerization (Docker, Kubernetes)
* Database Management: Experience with SQL
* Experience with Monitoring and Logging Tools


**The soft skills we look for:**
* People person, team player
* Problem-Solving Skill
* Fluent in English (international Team)
* Effective communication with fellow developers and stakeholders
* Excited for modern technology and learning everyday


 Mer information
   

  

**Our Offer**
 We offer a challenging and international work environment and the possibility to work with some of the best in the field. You will be working in interdisciplinary teams and you can always count on support from committed colleagues as ‘Ask and Share’ concept is essential for the way we work. We offer attractive employment conditions (smart working, flexible working hours and a good-work-life balance) and opportunities for personal and professional development. Click here for further information.
   

  

**Location**
 Solna
   

  

**For more information,** 
 you are welcome to contact the hiring manager Vidhu Agarwal vidhu.agarwal@vattenfall, com. For more information about the recruitment process, you are welcome to contact our recruiter Carolina Osterman carolina.osterman@vattenfall.com
   

  

 Trade Union representatives are Akademikerna – Sofi Wadström and Silvija Vatkovic, Ledarna – Christer Gustafsson, SEKO – Juha Siipilehto, Unionen – Inger Strandberg. You can reach them on 08-739 50 00.
   

  

**We welcome your application in English no later than 14th of December 2024.** 
 We kindly request that you do not send applications by any means other than via our website.
   

  

 At Vattenfall we are convinced that diversity contributes to build a more profitable and attractive company and we strive to be a good role model regarding diversity. Vattenfall works actively for all employees to have the same opportunities and rights regardless of gender, ethnicity, age, transgender identity or expression, religion or other belief, disability or sexual orientation. Click here for further information.
   

  

 The security of Vattenfall and its employees is essential. For that reason, a pre-employment screening will be part of your recruitment process. The screening is based on the role you will fulfill within Vattenfall.
   

  

 Since Vattenfall is a part of the Swedish critical infrastructure, many of our services are security classed. If this position is security classed the final candidates might be subjected to a security vetting process, according to the Swedish legislation.
   

  

 We look forward to receiving your application!
   

  

 Om oss
   

  

 Vattenfall is one of Europe’s largest producers and retailers of electricity and heat. Our main markets are Sweden, Germany, the Netherlands, Denmark, and the UK. The Vattenfall Group has approximately 21 000 employees. We have been electrifying industries, powering homes and transforming life through innovation for more than 100 years. We now want to make fossil free living possible within one generation and we are driving the transition to a sustainable energy system. To be able to reach this ambitious goal we are looking for talented individuals who, in addition to their passion for their role, also have strong team spirit and want to contribute to supporting a meaningful corporate mission.

title: SEB Tech Programme: Data Scientist
description:
**Vill du dyka in i en värld av data och utforska möjligheterna med maskininlärning? SEB Pension & Försäkring söker en Data Scientist!**
 Som Data Scientist inom Financial and Regulatory Reporting hos SEB Pension & Försäkring i Stockholm har du en nyckelroll när vi går mot en ännu mer datadriven verksamhet. Med hjälp av AI, maskininlärning och andra analysverktyg skapar vi nytta för hela SEB Pension & Försäkring!
   

  

 Parallellt med rollen som Data Scientist deltar du även i vårt talangprogram SEB Tech Programme, som ger dig en bred inblick i en stor och komplex, internationell organisation via fördjupat lärande och nätverkande. Med andra ord får du en unik möjlighet att utvecklas inom IT i en modern organisation med hög förändringstakt!
   

  

**Din framtida roll och ditt team**
 SEB Pension & Försäkring är ett av de ledande livförsäkringsbolagen i Norden med 1,8 miljoner kunder. Vi inom Financial and Regulatory Reporting stöttar hela Pension & Försäkring med analyser och beslutsunderlag med syftet att möjliggöra datadrivna beslut. Vi använder oss av Google Cloud som molnlösning och Vertex AI som AI-verktyg.
   

  

 Du blir en del av ett glatt och motiverat team med en stark samarbetsvilja. Vårt område är i en teknisk förändring där vår nyfikenhet och kunskap driver oss framåt. En viktig del i din roll är att arbeta proaktivt med analyser och utforska nya algoritmer och verktyg för att optimera det datadrivna arbetet på SEB Pension & Försäkring.
   

  

**Din framtida chef, Bo Anell, beskriver arbetet på Financial and Regulatory Reporting så här:**
*”Här är chansen för dig som vill bli en specialist inom Data Science! Hos oss har du en drivande roll där du använder ny teknik för att skapa och förbättra tillvägagångssätt för hur vi arbetar med data.”*
**Dina kvalifikationer**
 Har du passion för IT och är nyfiken på SEB? SEB Tech Programme ger dig en kickstart i din utveckling och karriär! Hos oss arbetar du nära dina kollegor i en miljö där nya tankesätt, idéer och initiativ står i centrum. Som person är du därför mån om att ständigt utveckla din kunskap, nyfiken på ny teknik och att arbeta tillsammans med ditt team för att driva förändring.
   

  

 Vi söker dig som:
   

  

* Har en akademisk examen IT eller teknik alternativt 2-årig YH-examen inom relevant område
* Tar examen innan programmets start eller har tagit examen inom de senaste två åren
* Är flytande i engelska, i tal och skrift.
* Du har kunskaper inom maskininlärning
* Det är meriterande med kunskaper i svenska. Det är även meriterande med arbetslivserfarenhet inom IT eller teknik alternativt bank eller försäkring


**Vårt erbjudande till dig**
 I över ett decennium har vi genom SEB Tech Programme erbjudit talanger som är i början av sin IT-karriär att utvecklas till vassa IT-specialister. Idag är SEB en av Sveriges största arbetsgivare inom IT, vilket ger dig goda och spännande möjligheter att förverkliga dina ambitioner.
   

  

 SEB erbjuder dig:
   

  

* Ett sex månader långt talangprogram inom IT, anpassat för professionell och personlig utveckling.
* Spännande affärsutmaningar och ett case-projekt där du kan skapa värde och skillnad för SEB:s affär och organisation.
* Möjligheten att skapa relationer och nätverk inom banken.
* Efter programmets slut är målet att erbjuda dig en anställning i den roll du har blivit antagen till.


**Vill du bli en del av SEB?**
 I den här rekryteringen samarbetar SEB med Ada Digital, som sköter hela rekryteringsprocessen på ett fördomsfritt och kompetensbaserat sätt. Du söker enkelt via ansökningsformuläret
 **här** 
 med ditt CV eller LinkedIn-profil, och alltid utan personligt brev. Notera dock att vi inte kan ta emot några ansökningar via email.
   

  

 Sök jobbet snarast om du är intresserad, men allra senast den 5:e januari! Om du har frågor om tjänsten, vänligen kontakta Sofie Nordvall på sofie.nordvall@adadigital.se
   

  

**Läs mer om hur det är att jobba på SEB här: www.sebgroup.com/career**
 Vi är övertygade om att inkludering och mångfald är avgörande för vår framtida framgång. Vi strävar efter en inkluderande och värderingsdriven kultur där medarbetare känner sig uppskattade, respekterade och engagerade oavsett vilka de är, vad de tror på eller var de kommer ifrån.
   

  

 Läs också gärna mer om SEB Tech Programmes upplägg och de andra lediga positionerna till starten 2025 här: https://sebgroup.com/sv/karriar/vem-ar-du/nyexaminerade-och-studenter/tech-program

title: Senior Data Engineer | Södertälje
description:
Join a team of passionate and innovative colleagues working on cutting-edge solutions for autonomous transport systems. Your primary responsibility will be to enhance operations by designing and implementing efficient data pipelines, enabling the effective use of data for decision-making and insights.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities** 
 :
 


* Design and develop robust data pipelines to integrate data from multiple sources for end-users.
* Create and manage Kafka topics across both cloud-based and on-premise environments.
* Identify and define scenarios to apply data-driven methods within autonomous transport systems.
* Develop software solutions and services tailored to autonomous transport systems.
* Design algorithms for advanced data analysis in the domain of autonomous systems.



  





**Preferred Skills** 
 :
 


* Familiarity with AI domains such as AI Planning, Generative AI, Knowledge Representation, and Autonomous Robotics is a plus.



**Technical Competencies** 
 :
 


* Expertise in
 **Apache Kafka** 
 for stream processing and event-driven systems.
* Proficient in developing scalable data pipelines using
 **Databricks** 
 , integrated with
 **AWS** 
 , to process and analyze large datasets.
* Strong experience with
 **AWS Cloud Computing Platform** 
 (experience with
 **Microsoft Azure** 
 is a bonus).
* Proficiency in
 **Terraform** 
 for infrastructure as code.
* Hands-on experience with
 **CI/CD pipelines** 
 and
 **GitLab** 
 .
* Solid programming skills in
 **Java** 
 and
 **Python** 
 , particularly for Machine Learning and Data Analytics.
* Familiarity with tools like
 **Apache Spark** 
 ,
 **TensorFlow** 
 , and
 **Databricks** 
 for data analytics and machine learning.
* Strong theoretical knowledge of Machine Learning, Big Data Analytics, and Statistics.
* Experience in alarming, monitoring, and logging for event-driven systems.

title: Produktspecialist med teknisk inriktning till Tre
description:
Vill du vara med och bygga telekoms bästa kundservice? Teamet Customer Service Development befinner sig i en spännande resa och har idag en ledande roll i att driva utvecklingen av kundupplevelse och digitalisering i framkant. Nu söker vi dig som vill vara med och bidra till att vi tar nästa steg i vår digitaliseringsresa!
   

  

**Lite mer om rollen**
 Som Produktspecialist har du konfigureringsansvaret över våra kundservicesystem Genesys Cloud, Zendesk och Boost.ai. Du är motorn i vårt förändringsarbete och behöver förstå och agera på användar- och kundbehov. Det ligger i ditt ansvar att identifiera och prioritera åtgärder och säkerställa att vi konfigurerar rätt utifrån dessa insikter.
   

  

 Varför är detta viktigt? Jo, det ligger till grund för våra beslut och actions när det gäller kundupplevelsen. Hur gör du det? Du är den som bygger rapporter kring datadrivna insikter i arbetet rörande kund- och användarflödena. Gör du det här själv? Ja, till stor del men du är ett starkt jag, i ett starkt lag som alltid hjälps åt för att vara vårt bästa. Du kommer att arbeta tvärfunktionellt med team från Customer Service, IT Development och IT Operations. Genom en tydlig och öppen kommunikation med dina stakeholders har du fokus på kontinuerlig dialog och förankring. Som vår tekniska produktspecialist inom contact center-domänen kommer du att säkerställa att våra system alltid är uppdaterade och optimerade.
   

  

**Du kan se fram emot att**
* få chansen att vara med och forma framtidens kundservice och digitala lösningar
* jobba i en spännande och varierande roll som har touch points på olika områden
* vara en del av Sveriges bästa arbetsplatser enligt Great Place To Work samt att vi är topprankade hos Karriärföretagen
* tillhöra en arbetsgivare som vill bidra till att kvinnor vill välja och stanna kvar inom teknikbranschen, vi är stolta partners till Women in Tech och Tjejer Kodar


**Lite mer om dig**
 Vi söker dig som har intresse för tekniska lösningar med kundupplevelsen i fokus. Du gillar nog att vägen framåt inte alltid är spikrak och att du får lösa problem och klurigheter på löpande band. Då dessa är system som alla är beroende av är du både proaktiv och uppvisar en stark vilja att hjälpa dina kollegor när stöttning behövs. Eftersom dina kontaktytor finns i flera olika delar utav organisationen ställer det krav på din goda kommunikativa förmåga för att säkerställa att arbetet bedrivs framåt.
   

  

 För att lyckas i rollen har du jobbat i en liknande roll och det är en bonus om du har kunskap om SaaS-system och de system vi använder. Du har tidigare erfarenhet av digitalisering inom kundservice och har jobbat med datadrivna- och processorienterade insikter. Det är meriterande om du har kunskap om konfigurering. Vi har medarbetare av många olika nationaliteter och det är därför en självklarhet att du talar och skriver svenska och engelska obehindrat.
   

  

**Din ansökan**
 Vi tar emot ansökningar via denna annons och kommer hålla intervjuer löpande. Personligt brev behövs inte, men vi vill gärna att du svarar på de frågor vi ställt nedan i samband med att du söker. Tjänsten kan komma att tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdag. Vid frågor kontakta rekryterande chef Sofia Levin.

title: Financial Crime Prevention Business Data Analyst
description:
**Job ID: 27069** 






  
 





 We are looking for a Business Data Analyst to join Group Financial Crime Prevention.
 





  
 





 Come and join the dynamic fight against international financial crime using the latest technologies and processes in a leading financial institution!
 





  
 





 Do you have an attitude that there will aways be a next level to archive? And do you believe that you can use that attitude to continuously bring us to the next levels when it comes to how we can leverage on data to support our business goals ? If you are ready to take the next step and create magic within Financial Crime Data Strategy and Governance as a Lead Business Data Specialist, let’s get in touch.
 





  
 





 This role exists within Group Financial Crime Prevention (GFCP) and the Financial Crime Application and Data (FCAD) unit. One of the areas under that unit is the Financial Crime Data Strategy Team. This team is responsible for GFCP Data Strategy and to ensure that the execution towards its target state is under control. Join us and be part of the development and running of the next generation data management capabilities for an effective battling of financial crimes.
 





  
 





 At Nordea, we’re committed to being a partner to our customers and society can count on. Compliance and integrity go hand in hand. Joining us means you’ll have an impact on how we do banking, today and tomorrow. So, bring your ideas, skills and unique background. With us, you’ll be in good company with plenty of opportunities to collaborate, grow and make your mark on something bigger.
 





  

  



**About this opportunity** 






  
 





 We are looking for a hungry and skilled analyst to join us. With us you will have the chance to be part of developing and use the latest ideas for how to develop, implement and run our Data Management landscape cross GFCP and Nordea. Together with your colleagues you will be defining what it mean to run a first-class data management landscape within GFCP.
 





  
 





 We endeavour to continually make improvements to ensure efficiency and on-going compliance with regulatory requirements and deliver solutions and services that help proactively prevent financial crime.
 





  
 





 Based upon your analysis, you will support and give direction in how to get the most from data based upon the business needs, existing as well as coming.
 





  
 





 In this role you will work very closely with all facets of the organisation including the data protection office to enhance and ensure good data management, in line with appropriate regulative requirements (e.g. GDPR).
 





  

  



**What you’ll be doing:** 





* Engaged in, and ensure, that there is a clear view on business requirements so needed supporting data management capabilities can be identified and developed
* Based upon business requirements be engage in the design the future of the financial crime prevention data management capabilities
* Engaged in translating strategies and Business Domains priorities into successful business outcomes
* Support in advise management and the business in the planning, management and decision processes with insight, analysis and business cases within GFCP
* For appointed capabilities, act as data related analyst
* Drive or support business requirement work to support product innovation and development to maximize the value of a defined entire value stream within GFCP
* Share you knowledge and insights to individuals and teams, to be part of growing talent and create new opportunities for aspiring professionals



  

  



 You’ll join a very highly skilled, passionate and forward thinking financial crime prevention team that has a key common drive to protect Nordea, its customers and, society at large. The role will be based in either Estonia, Finland, Poland or Sweden.
   

  





**Who you are**




 Collaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the values that guide us in being at our best – and that we imagine you share with us.  
 





  
 





 To build a successful career with us, you’ll work well with others and always act with the stakeholders’ needs in mind. You love learning and trying new things, and you’re excited about bringing your ideas to a reality that gives benefits to GFCP. You’re honest and dependable, willing to speak up even when it’s difficult, and committed to empowering others. You’re passionate about doing a great job.
 





  
 





 You have a passion for data, data quality and data management and how it can bring advantage in to an organization.
 





  

  



**To be able to create magic your background should include:** 





* Bachelor’s degree in business, data or technology subject area, or other equivalent higher education, or relevant experience
* At least 3 years of experience in data management and analysis
* Consulting skills
* You have been part of delivering Data Management implementations
* Demonstrable experience and understanding of data management framework
* Experience in business requirement work
* Understanding of data and information modelling and experience with common data management aspects (lineage, data mapping, data transformations, etc…)
* Fluent in English, both written and spoken (professional level)
* Experience from cloud based development
* Experienced in SQL



**Desirable:**



* Experience in crime prevention in a financial institution
* Experience in Python.
* Process modelling experience.
* Experienced in PowerBI



  
 





 If this sounds like you, get in touch!
 





  
 





**Next steps**




 Submit your application no later than
 



 30/11/2024
 



 . 
   

  

 At Nordea, we know that an inclusive workplace is a sustainable workplace. We deeply believe that our diverse backgrounds, experiences, characteristics and traits make us better at serving customers and communities. So please come as you are.
 





  
 





 Please be aware that any applications or CVs coming through email or direct messages will not be accepted or considered.
 





  
 





**For candidates in Sweden:** 
 For union information, please contact finansforbundet@nordea.se or SACONordea@nordea.com.
 





  
 





**For candidates in Poland:** 
 Please include permit for processing personal data in CV as following:
 





  
 





 In accordance with art. 6 (1) a and b. Regulation (EU) 2016/679 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 27 April 2016 on the protection of natural persons with regard to the processing of personal data and on the free movement of such data, and repealing Directive 95/46/EC (General Data Protection Regulation) hereinafter ‘GDPR’. I agree to have: my personal data, education and employment history proceeded for the purposes of current and future recruitment processes in Nordea Bank Abp.
 





  
 





 The administrator of your personal data is: Nordea Bank Abp operating in Poland through its Branch, address: Aleja Edwarda Rydza Śmiglego 20, 93-281 Łodź. Your personal data will be processed for the recruitment processes in Nordea Bank Abp. You have a right to access your personal data, right to rectify and right to delete. Disclosing the personal data in the scope specified by the provisions of Polish Labour Code from 26 June 1974 and executive acts are mandatory. Providing personal data is necessary to conduct the recruitment processes. The request for the deletion of your personal data means resignation from further participation in recruitment processes and causes the immediate removal of your application. Detailed information concerning processing of your personal data can be found at: nordea.com/en/doc/nordea-privacy-policy-for-applicants.pdf.
 





  

  



 We reserve the right to reply only to selected applications.

title: Data AI Engineer
description:
*Zelly är ett ledande ”born-in-the-cloud” företag . Vi utvecklar och optimerar molntjänster från Microsoft och ser till att våra kunder har tillgång till de bäst lämpade molntjänsterna för deras verksamhet.*
**Nu har du chansen att följa med på vår tillväxtresa!**
 Vi växer inom Data AI och vill därmed utöka vårt team med en Data Engineer som vill utvecklas, ta mer ansvar och ha kul på jobbet.
   

  

 Zelly är ett dynamiskt och snabbväxande Cloud-bolag som levererar alla Microsofts plattformar. Vi har en Cloud first-approach och ser styrkan i att nyttja synergier i Microsofts ekosystem. Zelly är den perfekta arbetsplatsen för dig som vill utvecklas, gillar att ta ansvar och ha möjligheten att påverka din arbetsplats. Vi ser att du är hungrig på ny teknik, vill hjälpa kunder till en bättre, enklare och säkrare vardag.
   

  

**Din roll:**
 Du kommer vara en del av Data AI teamet och jobba med projekt där du kommer vara delaktig i hela processen - från initial dialog med kunden och framtagning av kravspecifikationer och design, till implementering. Vardagen kommer innebära mycket kontakt med kunder och arbetet varierar mellan allt ifrån pre-sale, arkitektur, specificera anpassningar och integrationer, till att hålla i workshops och utbilda kunderna. Du kommer jobba både självständigt och i team där din åsikt och erfarenhet kommer att vara betydelsefull, samtidigt som det finns kollegor att bolla med. Du kommer få vara med och driva hur arbetssätt och tjänster inom Data AI området ska utvecklas tillsammans med Head of Innovation Services. Vi erbjuder en heltidstjänst som utgår från vårt kontor vid Gullmarsplan/Hammarby sjöstaden med frihet att arbeta från distans två dagar i veckan.
   

  

**Vi söker dig som har tidigare erfarenheter av:**
* SQL
* API
* Python/C#
* Microsoft komponenter (Fabric & Power Plattform)


**Det är meriterande om du erfarenheter av:**
* Azure alt annan Cloud plattform
* Högskoleutbildning inom ett relevant område för tjänsten


**För att trivas hos oss tror vi att du:**
* Nyfiken på olika verksamhetsprocesser och kunders behov
* Är intresserad av Microsoft cloud och dess utveckling
* Trivs med frihet under ansvar
* Är en lagspelare
* Gillar att utveckla rutiner och processer


**Dina möjligheter hos oss:**
* Bra villkor och stora utvecklingsmöjligheter i ett snabbt expanderande IT-bolag!
* Möjlighet till delägarskap i Aderian Group som är koncernen som Zelly ingår i
* Då vårt mål är att du ska bli bäst på molntjänster betalar vi gärna för din fortbildning. För när du utvecklas – utvecklas vi!
* Självklart erbjuder vi både förmåner och bonusar
* Roliga resor och aktiviteter tillsammans!


 Rekrytering sker löpande – där tillträde och lön sker enligt överenskommelse.
   

  

 Känns detta som en tjänst för dig? Skicka in din ansökan redan idag så kontaktar vi dig så snart som möjligt.
   

  

 Hoppas att vi hörs!

title: Data Engineering Lead
company_industry: Technology, Information and Media, Spectator Sports, and Entertainment Providers
description:
**Join the Shared Data team and shape our work by defining and executing architecture to reach the highest potential!** 




  





**WANT TO REVOLUTIONIZE GOLF?** 




  





**Our mission** 
 is to help people enjoy the wonderful game of golf even more by developing tracing technology for TV and gamification to ranges. Our product brings people together and encourages them to get active which enables a healthier lifestyle. Our range technology is used globally and millions of people spend their quality time bonding and playing with their family and friends. Our broadcast technology is aired worldwide and makes the tournaments really enjoyable for the TV viewers. ⛳️ 📺 🎥
 



  





**At our new office** 
 , you can expect to meet humble, helpful and driven colleagues. You will join an organization where everyone has a voice and can make an impact. You'll have the opportunity to contribute to something meaningful as we undergo exciting changes and growth. We are committed to creating an environment where you can grow professionally and individually. As well as creating a social work environment by creating fun activities like morning fika, gym sessions, mob programming, after-work, table tennis, and golf simulator sessions to name a few! 🥳 🏓 ☕️
 



  





**We are proud** 
 to be on a journey where we're focused on helping people worldwide improve their golf game which leads to healthy, active and social lifestyles. All of our products are developed, tested and deployed from our newly renovated R&D office in Stockholm, Sweden. Join us at Toptracer Technologies and be part of a team dedicated to creating positive change through technology and innovation! 🚀 💻 💙
 



  





**THE ROLE** 




 We are strengthening our Shared Data team with a Data Engineering Lead. As a Data Engineering Lead in the Shared Data team at Toptracer, you will be working with the central parts of the Data platform and pipelines. This role offers the exciting opportunity to consolidate data pipelines and databases into a newly set up data warehouse. You will have the chance to affect the architecture and design leaving a positive impact on the product. In this role, you will take the team and Toptracer to the next level.
 



  





 The position provides the advantage of involvement in diverse projects across different teams, helping them develop and improve their products. Additionally, there are opportunities to test product changes and see the results of your work in action by grabbing a golf club, swinging it, and seeing if the code you created reacts in the way you expect on the golf ball's trajectory.
 



  





 The team Shared data is responsible for data analysis, streaming services and API’s. They have a great culture and chemistry together. They work with agile methods and use Jira to structure their work.
 



  





 You will also have a big impact on consolidating the system we have today, the platform is both in the cloud and on-prem. You will together with the team and other teams at Toptracer make the platform more robust and scalable than it is today.
 



  





 You are a quick learner who enjoys understanding new tech stacks and applying suitable technology to the tasks at hand. You are open-minded and can consider the pros and cons of multiple alternative solutions. You have a passion for data, coding, problem-solving, and a deep understanding of the needs of data for analysis and services.
 



  





**TECH STACK** 




 AWS | GitLab | Kafka | RabbitMQ | Python | Firehose | Kubernetes | PostgreSQL
 



 (all mentioned above is not required to apply)
 



  





**POSSIBILITIES** 



* Innovate to make golf more accessible
* High degree of impact of Toptracers Data platform
* Close collaboration with multiple teams and products
* Latest libraries and technology
* Affect the architecture and design leaving a positive impact on the product
* Broad range of technology and development opportunities
* Analysis of data
* Working in an agile environment
* Be part of the golf revolution to create moments that matter



  





**WE BELIEVE YOU HAVE** 



* 5+ years of experience working as a Data Engineer
* Professional experience and knowledge of Data platforms and pipelines
* Data model frameworks, principles, and best practices
* Experience with data warehouses
* Experience in architecture and design of Data platforms and pipelines
* An understanding of trends and opportunities to ensure we are following best practices
* Experience in managing cloud infrastructure, preferably AWS
* An understanding of the software development process and identifying the needs of a back-end developer
* At least two years of experience working in Python



  





**MORE ABOUT TOPTRACER** 




  





**Workplace** 




  





 We value fully engaged associates who come to work because they enjoy their work and the colleagues they have. We strive to create a diverse and inclusive work environment where everybody can reach their full potential. We provide opportunities for all the colleagues to develop internally and to meet each other. We have a strong commitment and dedication at Toptracer. That comes from the activities and moments we share together and the product we are developing.
 



  





 In addition to that, our technology is unique and world-leading which makes the journey extra exciting. We create a product that encourages people to be outside and get activated which enables a healthier lifestyle. As a colleague at Toptracer, you can either go to a range near your home to experience the product you have developed or just turn on the TV to see it in the biggest golf tournaments.
 



  





**Culture** 




 Our culture is driven by our mission to create moments that matter for everyone and our values for Caring, Courage, One Team, Fun and Excellence.
 



  





**Activities** 



* After-work
* Pair/Mob programming
* Conference
* Dart
* Gym sessions
* Table-tennis
* Golf simulator
* Golf tournaments



  





**Benefits** 



* Competitive salary and benefits package.
* Opportunity to work on cutting-edge technologies and projects.
* Collaborative and innovative work environment.
* Professional development and growth opportunities.
* A hybrid work environment with the primary workplace at our cozy and welcoming office in Mörby Centrum, Danderyd.
* And of course, play golf!



  





 The position is permanent and full-time, located at our office in Stockholm. We hope to hear from you soon!

title: Software Engineer, Sustaining Engineering
description:
This is a fast-paced engineering role in Linux-based software-defined infrastructure and applications, covering all layers of the stack, including bare metal, virtualization (KVM) and containerization (Docker/LXC/LXD), storage (Ceph and Linux filesystems), networking (OVS, OVN and Core networking), up to OpenStack and Kubernetes, and the open source applications running on top of them. It will challenge you to show the breadth of engineering skill needed to work on almost any aspect of Ubuntu and the open source things people run with it.
   

  

 This role is an opportunity for a technologist with a passion for Linux and open source to build a career with Canonical and drive success for our customers, community and the company. If you have an affinity for open source development, great communication skills, and a passion for troubleshooting and fixing issues in technology used by millions across the world, then you will enjoy working with some of the best people in the industry at Canonical.
   

  

**Location:** 
 This is a remote role, we have teams in all time zones.
   

  

 This role deals with critical issues in the open source stack that require software engineering for upstream bug fixes. Our engineers have to be able to work productively at any level of the stack above the kernel, in a wide range of languages, to understand and address the software issues at hand. Our group is critical to the success of our enterprise customers, partners and Ubuntu itself.
   

  

 You will help with troubleshooting and driving issues to resolution with workarounds, guidance, and bug fixes to be released upstream and in Ubuntu.
   

  

 What your day will look like
   

  

* Resolve complex customer problems related to Ubuntu, Kernel, Ceph, OpenStack, or Kubernetes and other open source software
* Maintain a close working relationship with Canonical's field, support and product engineering teams
* Participate in upstream communities
* Develop bug fixes, backport patches, and work with upstream for inclusion
* Review code produced by other engineers
* Demonstrate good judgment in technical methods and techniques
* Prioritize work and manage your time effectively against those priorities
* Participate in team discussions to improve processes, tools, and documentation
* Maintain clear, technical and concise communications
* Work from home and travel internationally up to 10% of work time for team meetings, events and conferences


 What we are looking for in you
   

  

* Professional experience as a software engineer
* Background in Computer Science, STEM or similar
* **Strong** 
 experience with Linux, and at least one of the following:
+ Ceph, OpenStack, Kubernetes or other cloud technologies

* Strong development-level experience with at least one of Python, Go, C or C++ on Linux
* Ability to troubleshoot with debugging tools like gdb
* Familiarity with git source code repositories and branches
* An exceptional academic track record
* Willingness to travel up to 4 times a year for internal events


**Additional Skills That You Might Also Bring**
* You love technology and working with brilliant people
* You are curious, flexible, articulate, and accountable
* You value soft skills and are passionate, enterprising, thoughtful, and self-motivated
* You have interest in, and experience with most of the following: Ubuntu Linux - kernel or userspace, Kubernetes, OpenStack, Ceph, QEMU/KVM, LXC/LXD, Python, Go, C, Postgresql, Mongo, Debian packaging, distributed systems


 What we offer you
   

  

 We consider geographical location, experience, and performance in shaping compensation worldwide. We revisit compensation annually (and more often for graduates and associates) to ensure we recognize outstanding performance. In addition to base pay, we offer a performance-driven annual bonus. We provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. We balance our programs to meet local needs and ensure fairness globally.
   

  

* Distributed work environment with twice-yearly team sprints in person - we've been working remotely since 2004!
* Personal learning and development budget of USD 2,000 per year
* Annual compensation review
* Recognition rewards
* Annual holiday leave
* Maternity and paternity leave
* Employee Assistance Programme
* Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues from your team and others
* Priority Pass for travel and travel upgrades for long haul company events


**About Canonical**
 Canonical is a pioneering tech firm that is at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world on a daily basis. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do.
   

  

 Canonical has been a remote-first company since its inception in 2004. Work at Canonical is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game. Canonical provides a unique window into the world of 21st-century digital business.
   

  

 Canonical is an equal opportunity employer
   

  

 We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

title: Salesforce Developer
description:
***Ready to design and develop innovative Salesforce solutions? Take ownership of scalable systems and drive impact as Aimo’s Salesforce Developer—apply now!***




  





**Salesforce Developer** 




  





**Join Aimo and Shape the Future of Salesforce Solutions** 




*Are you a Salesforce enthusiast ready to make an impact? Aimo is looking for a talented Salesforce Developer to take ownership of our Salesforce ecosystem, supporting operations across Sweden, Finland, and Norway. This is your opportunity to bring innovative ideas to life in a dynamic environment focused on growth and transformation.* 




  





**About the Role** 




 As a Salesforce Developer, you’ll be part of Aimo’s dedicated CRM team, responsible for servicing all Nordic operations. Your role will involve designing, developing, and maintaining Salesforce solutions that empower the organization. You’ll work closely with internal stakeholders, including product owners and solution architects, to create workflows, optimize processes, and implement scalable solutions tailored to business needs.
 



  





**Your Key Responsibilities** 



* **Salesforce Development** 
 : Develop custom applications and integrations within Salesforce using Apex, Visualforce, and Lightning Components.
* **Salesforce Administration** 
 : Manage users, roles, profiles, and streamline and automate business processes.
* **Sales and Service Cloud Management** 
 : Configure and optimize features to support business processes, streamline sales cycles, and enhance customer service capabilities.
* **UI/UX Development** 
 : Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to design and implement user-friendly designs and scalable solutions.
* Manage integrations between Salesforce and other systems.
* Lead deployments in test environments and ensure seamless implementations.
* Participate in solution design discussions and drive best practices for scalability and efficiency.



  





**Who You Are** 



* At least 5 years of experience as a Salesforce Developer with expertise in Apex, Visualforce, and Lightning Components.
* Skilled in optimizing Sales and Service Cloud modules and applying UI/UX design principles within Salesforce.
* Strong technical knowledge of APIs, system integration, and scalable solution development.
* Collaborative and effective in delivering impactful solutions with internal stakeholders.
* Thrives in dynamic environments, tackling challenges with structure and creativity while embracing iterative development and continuous improvement.
* Proficient in English; knowledge of Swedish, Finnish, or Norwegian is a bonus.
* Salesforce certifications are a plus.



  





**About Aimo** 




*At Aimo, we have embarked on an exciting journey to become the most attractive partner in mobility. Our mission is to contribute to healthy and sustainable social development by offering mobility services that make cities smarter and everyday life easier. We’re driven by innovation, collaboration, and a commitment to making a difference for our customers and communities.* 




  





**Why Join Aimo?** 




*Aimo is on a transformative journey, and we’re bringing our CRM expertise in-house to drive innovation. By joining us, you’ll play a key role in delivering scalable solutions to support all Nordic countries while contributing to sustainable social development and smarter cities.* 




  





**How to Apply** 




 We are reviewing applications on a rolling basis. Don’t miss your chance to make an impact—apply today!

title: Client Director
description:
**Vi söker en affärsdriven Client Director till Dentsu Creative – en globalt prisbelönt byrå med ett spännande och integrerat erbjudande.** 




  





**OM TJÄNSTEN** 




 Som Client Director har du det yttersta ansvaret för våra kunders tillväxt och utveckling. Ta del av vår starka kundportfölj och få även chans att vinna nya affärer till byrån. I rollen har du ambitiösa budgetmål, både för befintliga kunder och new business. Tack vare våra samarbeten inom dentsu-huset finns ett stort kontaktnät med starka kundrelationer att bygga vidare på.
 



  





 Du arbetar tillsammans med ett team av strateger, kreatörer, specialister, projektledare och produktionsledare. Tillsammans driver ni kampanjer, strategier och olika typer av kreativa kommunikationslösningar. Du bör vara mångsidig och van vid att driva olika typer av projekt, team och kunder. Du har goda projektledaregenskaper och värdesätter nära samarbete med såväl kund som kollegor. Du agerar rådgivare för dina kunder men utvecklar och inspirerar även dina kollegor.
 



  





 Du driver pitcher, proaktiva nykundsprojekt, offertförfrågningar och upphandlingar. Du verkar även för integrerade affärsmöjligheter med våra andra dentsu Service Lines, CXM och Media. Beroende på tidigare erfarenhet och intressen kan en del affärsutvecklingsansvar innefattas i rollen.
 



  





 Du tillhör ett av våra Business Teams, där vi växeldrar och hjälps åt med ett “Let’s do it”-mindset. Viktigt är att du är prestigelös och van att röra dig mellan en säljande roll, projektledare och ibland tom kan steppa in och stötta i mer operativa uppgifter. Du rapporterar till vår Business Director.
 



  





  





**I rollen kommer du att:** 




  




* Ha löpande kundkontakt och ansvara för att leda ett antal kunder
* Driva kundteam i olika typer av projekt och processer
* Jobba löpande med lönsamhet och tillväxt mot satta budgetmål
* Driva pitcher och proaktiva införsäljningsprojekt för att nå satta nykundsmål
* Sätta kundplaner, projektplaner, samt driva och följa upp dessa både internt och externt
* Tillsammans med strateger, planners och kreatörer initiera strategier, konceptarbeten, kampanjer och olika typer av varumärkesstärkande lösningar
* Delta i utvalda interna growth- och businessforum
* Arbeta och rapportera i verktyg som Salesforce och Marathon
* Tillsammans med projekt- och/eller produktionsledare kvalitetssäkra leveranser
* Bevaka projektens och kundens totala lönsamhet
* Delta och engagera dig i Dentsu Creatives gemensamma aktiviteter



  





  





**VEM ÄR DU?** 




 Du har minst 8 års erfarenhet från byråsidan i liknande befattning, med god erfarenhet av kundansvar, senior projektledning och försäljning. Du drivs av affär, att ständigt utmanas och att växa genom att fördjupa din kompetens inom kreativ kommunikation. Du ödmjuk, utåtriktad, nyfiken och helhetsfokuserad. Du är van att rådge kunder – och känner dig utmanad och motiverad av att, tillsammans med specialister, driva bred och mångsidig kommunikation. Du är noggrann, ansvarstagande och värdesätter goda relationer med såväl kunder som kollegor. Du räds inte för att ta tag i krävande situationer som kan uppstå när riktigt bra kommunikation skapas.
 



  





  





 Sammanfattningsvis söker vi dig om har:
 


* Minst 8 års erfarenhet av senior projektledning och kundansvar
* Dokumenterad erfarenhet av kundansvar, budgetansvar och försäljning
* Erfarenhet från byrå- eller konsultsidan
* Erfarenhet av att jobba med olika typer av kommunikationsdiscipliner



  





  





**OM DENTSU CREATIVE & DENTSU** 




 Dentsu Creative är en sammanslagning av de tidigare byråerna Isobar, John Brown och MKTG – och är nu en kreativ byrå i ett globalt nätverk. Vi tror att kreativ kommunikation har möjligheten påverka samhällen, bygga kultur och forma framtiden. Vi sätter lika stort värde på kreativt tänkande som digital förståelse och lösningar som skapar affärsnytta. På Dentsu Creative skapar vi varumärkesplattformar, reklam och sociala medie-kampanjer – men även content, PR-aktiveringar och event. I Sverige har vi siktet inställt på att bli en av branschens ledande kreativa byråer.
 



  





 På Dentsu Creative har du kollegor över hela världen. Totalt är vi cirka 9 000 personer på 145 marknader. Dentsu som globalt media- och kommunikationsnätverk har hela 47 000 medarbetare och erbjuder tjänster inom Media, Creative och CXM via våra ledande byråer Carat, dentsuX, iProspect, Dentsu Creative och Merkle.
 



  





 Som arbetsgivare erbjuder dentsu bland annat:
 


* Kollektivavtal
* 5000 kronor i friskvårdsbidrag
* 30 dagars semesterrätt
* Flexibilitet och en mix av hemarbete och en motiverande kontorsmiljö på central adress
* Stora karriärs- och utvecklingsmöjligheter



  





**Ansökan och kontakt** 




 Har du erfarenhet från liknande roll, är dedikerad i ditt sätt att växa affär och tycker att Dentsu Creative och dentsu låter spännande? Sök nu!
 



  





 Vi erbjuder en tillsvidareanställning med 6 månaders inledande provanställning. Tjänsten är placerad i Stockholm
 



 Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig!
 



 Vid frågor, kontakta:
 



 Maria K. Cederbrand, Senior Talent Acquisition Partner
 




 maria.cederbrand@dentsu.com

title: Sr Named Account Manager, Sweden
company_industry: Computer and Network Security and Software Development
description:
It's fun to work in a company where people truly BELIEVE in what they're doing!
   

  

*We're committed to bringing passion and customer focus to the business.*
****Corporate Overview****
 Proofpoint is a leading cybersecurity company protecting organizations’ greatest assets and biggest risks vulnerabilities in people. With an integrated suite of cloud-based solutions, Proofpoint helps companies around the world stop targeted threats, safeguard their data, and make their users more resilient against cyber attacks. Leading organizations of all sizes, including more than half of the Fortune 1000, rely on Proofpoint for people-centric security and compliance solutions mitigating their most critical risks across email, the cloud, social media, and the web.
   

  

 We are singularly devoted to helping our customers protect their greatest assets and biggest security risk their people. That’s why we’re a leader in next-generation cybersecurity.
   

  

****Corporate Overview****
 Proofpoint is a leading cybersecurity company protecting organizations’ greatest assets and biggest risks vulnerabilities in people. With an integrated suite of cloud-based solutions, Proofpoint helps companies around the world stop targeted threats, safeguard their data, and make their users more resilient against cyber-attacks. Leading organizations of all sizes, including more than 50% of the Fortune 1000, rely on Proofpoint for people-centric security and compliance solutions mitigating their most critical risks across email, the cloud, social media, and the web.
   

  

 We are singularly devoted to helping our customers protect their greatest assets and biggest security risk their people. That’s why we’re a leader in next-generation cybersecurity.
   

  

**The Role**
 We are seeking a proactive, creative, and tenacious Enterprise Account Manager to drive new cyber security business across multiple vertical markets across The Nordics. This role will demand interaction with large scale enterprises at the ‘C’ level, as well as with technical staff within the security and IT organisation.
   

  

 You will manage a portfolio of approximately 20 named accounts, encompassing a mix of white-space and existing customers. Selling the full Proofpoint Platform, while leveraging all internal resources and our ecosystem of partners to enable continued growth of your account portfolio. In this role you will be able to expand the Proofpoint footprint, ensuring your customers are effectively protected from advanced threats and targeted attacks by our award winning technology.
   

  

**Your day-to-day**
* Establish strong business relationships at the executive level within Nordic Enterprise accounts above 2,500 users (cross-vertical focus)
* Focus on both penetrating new accounts as well as expanding our presence with existing customers by introducing them to all our security, compliance and information protection platform.
* Articulate and promote the company’s value proposition and services to become a trusted advisor within your customer base
* Work with internal resources, including aligned System Engineers to prepare account strategies and plans.
* Collaborate with Systems Engineers to organise and deliver compelling and flawless product demonstrations
* Partner with the channel ecosystem to gain access into new accounts
* Deliver operational excellence, to include forecast accuracy and pipeline generation progression
* Maintain up-to-date knowledge of Proofpoint’s competitive positioning in the marketplace


****What You Bring To The Team****
* Experienced technology sales professional, with a particular focus on SaaS value-based technologies. Experience within Cyber Security is an advantage.
* Proven track record of over-achieving targets, net new logo achievements and capacity to leverage channel partnerships within The Nordics
* Relentless attention to detail and never-give-up attitude with a high level of activity, i.e., customer and partner meetings emphasizing executive value selling (CISO, CIO, CMO, etc.)
* Ability to establish business relationships at the executive level, and ability to become a trusted client advisor
* Experience of closing complex opportunities in the range of $100k – $1m
* Proficient user of formal sales playbook methodologies e.g. MEDDIC, Challenger, TAS, Command of the Message.
* Growth mindset, willingness to be coached, and diligence to follow a proven sales process
* Entrepreneurial self-starter with a consistent focus on account planning, pipeline generation and opportunity progression. You’re strategic in approach, but always act with urgency.
* Preferably you’ll have experience of using Salesforce
* Fluency in Swedish and English is required


**Why Proofpoint**
* Supportive leadership; an inclusive and employee centric culture
* Award winning and market leading technology
* We invest in our sales teams, through world-class leadership & enablement programs


**Why Proofpoint**
 Protecting people is at the heart of our award-winning cybersecurity solutions, and the people who work here are the key to our success. We’re a customer-focused and driven-to-win organisation with leading-edge products. We are an inclusive, diverse, multinational company that believes in culture fit, but more importantly ‘culture-add’, and we strongly encourage people from all walks of life to apply.
   

  

 We believe in hiring the best and the brightest to help cultivate our culture of collaboration and appreciation. Apply today and explore your future at Proofpoint!
   

  

*If you like wild growth and working with happy, enthusiastic over-achievers, you'll enjoy your career with us!*
*If you like wild growth and working with happy, enthusiastic over-achievers, you'll enjoy your career with us!*

title: PHP Developer
company_industry: Software Development, IT Services and IT Consulting, and Information Services
description:
Do you want to help us unleash the secret to how happy employees create a happy business? We are an innovative, agile, and continuously growing modern tech company on a path to improving the work lives of millions around the world.
 



  





**We develop workforce management solutions** 
 - software that makes scheduling and time reporting more smooth and more flexible for almost a million users worldwide!
 



  





**We value passion, quality, innovation, trust, and collaboration.** 
 You’ll be given the opportunity to make an impact and directly contribute to our success, bring new ideas, and have full ownership of your area.
 



  





 Our global team, of more than 35 nationalities, have fun together, whether it is during a typical Swedish Fika, a workshop, going for a run with a colleague, or spending time together during team kickoffs, or after-work socials. We have built a collaborative and friendly atmosphere here at Quinyx and are committed to sharing knowledge and supporting one another!
 



 Are you curious and ready to take the first steps on an awesome journey and make magic happen with us? As a member of Quinyx, you will be part of an inclusive and diverse workplace where everyone is allowed to be themselves and thrive.
 



  





**We have a hybrid working set up and therefore you will be required to attend our Stockholm office twice per week.** 




  





**About the role** 




  





 We are looking for an experienced PHP developer with a strong technical background to join our fantastic Core team.
 



 You will work in the Core team as a PHP developer, creating new features, API endpoints, fixing bugs, and refactoring existing functionality.
 



 The team consists of seven PHP developers and two QA members working together.
 



 In our project ecosystem, apart from PHP services, we also have services built with Java, so you will have the opportunity to work with new technologies and learn new skills.
 



  





**What you’ll be doing** 



* Working in a self-managing team based on Agile principles
* Implementing new and maintaining existing functionality in our services built with pure PHP and Laravel
* Refactoring codebase to enhance performance and security
* Participating in planning, discovering solutions and initiating innovations



  





**What you’ll bring to the team** 



* Multiple years of experience in PHP development
* Skills in high-performance scalable system development
* Strong set of soft skills, including effective communication, teamwork, and problem-solving abilities.
* Excellent English, both spoken and written



  





**The WOW-factor** 



* Knowledge of Java, Cloud technologies, and experience with high-loaded systems is a plus.
* You enjoy working in a highly independent, cross-functional team with a never-ending drive to deliver great software, with a special focus on performance, maintainability, and usability. You achieve this by understanding our users' needs and cooperating effectively with the team.
* Experience with handling technical debt and working with legacy code is a plus.



  





**What’s in it for you?** 




 We promote and encourage a healthy lifestyle with flexible work hours and the latest tools, enhanced vacation allowance, wellness, home office, professional development contributions, virtual yoga classes, and last but not least, you will have the chance to participate in our well-known yearly ping-pong tournament!
 



  





**Want to join Quinyx?** 




 At Quinyx, we provide equal employment opportunities and strive for an inclusive, diverse, value-driven culture. All applications will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, disability, or veteran status.
 



  





**Happy Workforce, Happy Business!**

title: Fund SME (Subject Matter Expert)
description:
**Role Description**
 FNZ is the market leading provider of technology and administration services to major financial institutions in the platform and wealth management sectors across the globe. We partner with life companies, banks, asset managers and discretionary wealth managers to enable them to develop and distribute financial products and services to their customers across all major distribution channels.
   

  

 We are now hiring a Fund SME (Subject matter expert) to join our enthusiastic team, in our new and modern office in the centre of Stockholm.
   

  

 Your role is wide-ranging.
   

  

* You are a process expert within the team, deal with complex issues and deliver resolution. You are capable of analysing problems and identifying the core issues and generating appropriate solutions using sound judgement to solve problems.
* You provide support to Operations and the business as a whole, based on your comprehensive and up-to-date technical understanding of platform functionality and operations.
* As a Specialist, you actively monitor future market changes and are able to assess the impact of the changes on the team's operations, participate in the planning, documenting, testing and implementation of changes along with supporting the team. You strive to continuously improve the processes in place and ensure that they are up-to-date, correct, of high quality and efficient.


**Experience Required**
**Required Knowledge & Skills**
* A degree or equivalent in a finance, business or numerate discipline.
* Operations experience within the Wealth Management / Platform industry.
* Expertise in the Swedish market and regulation
* Deep knowledge in Mutual fund asset transfers journey between Swedish providers on the Swedish market
* An expertise in fund administration
* Experience in client services.
* Experience in using Excel for data analysis.
* The ability to work accurately and to deadlines.
* Capability of managing multiple priorities at the same time and take personal responsibility for achieving them
* Excellent interpersonal and strong communication skills.
* Self-motivated and ability to quickly learn new things. Effective way of working.
* Good team work skills and ability to share your experiences and thoughts with your colleagues
* English and Swedish fluent


**Preferred Knowledge & Skills**
* Proposition knowledge of platform industry, from Retail Client to Asset Servicing delivery.
* Technical operational knowledge relative to the team under role holders’ remit,
* Change management experience,
* Understand of risk/compliance policies and processes for a financial services business
* Able to demonstrate understanding of regulations that apply within the region


**About FNZ Culture**
 Our culture is what drives us. It's at the heart of who we are and everything we do. It's what inspires, excites and moves us forward. Our ambition is to create a culture for growth, one that opens up limitless opportunities for our employees, customers and the wider world. At FNZ we know that great impact is only possible with great teamwork.
   

  

 That’s why we value the strength and diversity of thought in our global team.
   

  

 The FNZ Way is the cornerstone of what we do. It is comprised of four values that set the standard for how everyone at FNZ interacts with each other, with our customers, and with all our diverse stakeholders around the world.
   

  

 Customer obsessed for the long-term
   

  

 Think big and make an impact
   

  

 Act now and own it all the way
   

  

 Challenge, commit and win together
   

  

 Read more about The FNZ Way and our values: www.fnz.com/culture
   

  

**Opportunities**
* Right from day one, you will work alongside exceptional, multicultural teams - experts in their respective fields - who will inspire and challenge you to make your greatest impact.
* Be part of a highly successful, rapidly growing, global business that is leading the delivery of financial services via cloud computing and partners with some of the world’s largest companies;
* Working in a flexible and agile way that meets the needs of the business and personal circumstances;
* Remuneration, significant financial rewards and career advancement is based on individual contribution and business impact rather than tenure or seniority;
* We provide global career opportunities for our best employees at any of our offices in the UK, EU, US, Canada, South Africa and APAC.


**Commitment to Equal Opportunities**
 At FNZ, we recognise that diversity, equity and inclusion are important factors contributing to our success. We embrace the unique perspective and capabilities of our current and future employees, which will help us continue to drive innovation and achieve our business goals. Recruitment decisions at FNZ are made in a non-discriminatory manner without regard to gender, ethnicity/race, faith, age, nationality, gender identity, sexual orientation, marital status, socio-economic background, disability or military veteran status where all applicants and employees are valued and respected.
   

  

 In addition, we want to ensure accessibility needs are well supported, if you require specific support please advise us.
   

  

**About FNZ**
*FNZ is committed to opening up wealth so that everyone, everywhere can invest in their future on their terms. We know the foundation to do that already exists in the wealth management industry, but complexity holds firms back.*
*We created wealth’s growth platform to help. We provide a global, end-to-end wealth management platform that integrates modern technology with business and investment operations. All in a regulated financial institution.*
*We partner with over 650 financial institutions and 12,000 wealth managers, with US$1.5 trillion in assets under administration (AUA).*
*Together with our customers, we help over 20 million people from all wealth segments to invest in their future.*

title: SharePoint-Utvecklare
description:
Är du en skicklig SharePoint-utvecklare som vill bli en del av ett dynamiskt och växande IT-konsultföretag? På Sii Sverige söker vi en talangfull utvecklare som vill vara med i vårt team och bidra till spännande projekt med ledande företag inom olika branscher.
 



 Vi är dedikerade till att stödja utvecklingen av våra anställda. Därför har vi ett brett utbildnings- och mentorerbjudande, liksom andra förmåner som pensionsplan, försäkring, friskvårdsbidrag, regelbundna AW och mycket mer. Ansök för att få reda på mer!
 



  





**Uppgifter** 



* Designa, utveckla och implementera SharePoint-lösningar efter kundens behov
* Anpassa SharePoint-webbplatser, applikationer och arbetsflöden
* Integrera SharePoint med andra Microsoft-verktyg (t.ex. Microsoft 365, Teams, Power Platform)
* Felsöka och lösa SharePoint-relaterade problem och optimera prestanda
* Samarbeta med kunder och interna team för att samla in krav och leverera högkvalitativa lösningar



  





**Kunskaper** 



* Stark kunskap om SharePoint Online, SharePoint 2013/2016/2019 och Microsoft 365
* Kunskaper i programmeringsspråk som C#, .NET, JavaScript, HTML/CSS och PowerShell
* Erfarenhet av SPFx och att bygga anpassade webbdelar
* Kännedom om Power Platform och integrationer med SharePoint
* Tidigare erfarenhet av migreringsprojekt
* Flytande engelska



  





**Meriterande** 



* Kunskaper inom SQL Server, REST API och Azure Services
* Erfarenhet av Microsoft Azure DevOps för CI/CD
* Kunskap om bästa praxis för styrning, efterlevnad och säkerhet inom SharePoint-miljöer
* Flytande svenska är ett stort plus

title: Managing Attorney, Technology Compliance & Digital Responsibility (R-16392)
Knowledge Graph consultant
description:
Insights & data is a global business line within Capgemini, comprising 27,000 experts. Our focus? Creating cutting-edge machine learning and AI solutions on reliable, scalable data platforms. From Gen-AI to business intelligence, we cover it all. Join us in transforming industries through end-to-end Data & AI solutions. We work across industries and have a collaborative environment, where your unique perspective matters.
 



 Join our team as a Knowledge Graph consultant!
 



  





 YOUR ROLE
 



 Are you passionate about shaping the future through data-driven insights? Imagine a role where you collaborate with clients, unravel complex challenges, and drive meaningful impact. As a Knowledge Graph consultant, you’ll be at the forefront of innovation, using semantic technology and other modern tech stacks like Generative AI or LLM to transform businesses.
 



  





 What You’ll Do:
 



 • Semantic Technologies: We work with clients using a wide range of tools such as the whole of W3C Semantic Stack (RDF, RDFS, SPARQL, OWL, SHACL), graph databases, ontology modelling and tech stack such as Neo4j or other Labeled Property Graph implementations.
 



 • Data Alchemy: Dive into data wrangling, craft algorithms, and deploy solutions that matter and create insights. ETL processes with various graph databases.
 



 • Data Modeling: Craft effective data models that represent business entities and relationships.
 



 • Wide Horizons: From tackling the complexities of fraud detection to enhancing user experiences through sophisticated product recommendation, the variety is vast.
 



 • Cloud Expertise: We’re all about Databricks and cloud platforms (Azure, AWS, Google Cloud).
 



 • Knowledge Sharing: We actively promote knowledge sharing and skills development at Capgemini. You’ll belong to specific areas of expertise (capability area), where lessons learnt, and experiences are shared. We think you will be happy to help upskill our junior talents if need be.
 



 • Client Interaction: As part of a team, you’ll engage with clients, understanding their needs and developing optimal technical solutions, for them to become more data-driven.
 



 • Flexible Approach: We are seeking a dynamic consultant who is eager to primarily focus on knowledge graph development, while also being flexible and enthusiastic about contributing to various data science projects if needed.
 



 • International Collaborations: Our Knowledge graph team in I&D Sweden are collaborating with our neighboring countries. This opens up the opportunity for our Knowledge graph consultants to work internationally if that is within your interests.
 



  





 YOUR PROFILE
 



 • Experience: With domain experience in knowledge graph technologies, you also enjoy solving complex modeling problems. You have experience in Interaction with graph databases through standardized APIs and query languages.
 



 • Programming skills: Programming skills (specific language is not required, but we use Python or Java).
 



 • Knowledge: Knowledge about Linked Data Concepts & Information and Data Management
 



 • Pedagogical Flair: Comfortable explaining Knowledge graph to clients or stakeholders.
 



 • Academic Roots: Math’s, Statistics or Data science—your foundation matters.
 



 • Language Mastery: You speak Swedish and English fluently—essential for client interactions.
 



  





 Bonus Points for:
 



 • Generative AI: Unleash creativity.
 



 • MLOps Champion: CI/CD, continuous training—your playground.
 



 • Stable Solutions: Kubernetes and Docker mastery.
 



 • Business Acumen: Beyond code, grasp the bigger picture.
 



  





 WHAT WE BELIEVE YOU WILL ENJOY ABOUT WORKING HERE
 



 We recognize the significance of flexible work arrangements to provide support. Be it remote work , or flexible work hours, you will get an environment to maintain healthy work life balance.
 



 At the heart of our mission is your career growth. Our array of career growth programs and diverse professions are crafted to support you in exploring a world of opportunities.
 



 Equip yourself with valuable certifications in the latest technologies, for example within Semantics or Generative AI.
 



 APPLICATION
 



 Ready to shape the future? Apply now.
 



  





 ABOUT CAPGEMINI
 



 Capgemini is a global business and technology transformation partner, helping organizations accelerate their dual transition to a digital and sustainable world while creating a tangible impact for enterprises and society. It is a responsible and diverse group of 340,000 team members in more than 50 countries. With its strong over 55-year heritage, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to unlock the value of technology to address the entire breadth of their business needs.
